folder: Franklin Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Franklin Street, west from, but not including Greenwich to West streets. This night view of the wholesale market is taken from the Franklin Street station of the Ninth Ave. Elevated Line. Intersecting street in the foreground, is Washington Street.

Oct ober 15, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same.

October 15, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Franklin Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY
text:

folder: Greenwich Street & Franklin Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Greenwich Street, south from Franklin (In No. 1) and Warren (in No's. 2 & 3) Streets, showing the Ninth Avenue elevated line overhanging the Street. Prominent buildings seen in No. 1 are the Woolworth, a loft structure at the S.E. corner of Greenwich and Jay Streets, the new downtown Post Office and the City Bank Farmers Trust Co. Bldg. Views 2 and 3 show mainly the recently completed Post Office Bldg.

July 4, 1938. Views 1, 2 and 3

P. L. Sperr

D4 Neg. # 4041
